result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeanette Deltrese Lee Kolpien

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Jeanette Deltrese Lee Kolpien does not appear,  Atty Scott Selmer, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF107, 22TR923 and 22TR924 (STC). ADA  Schieffer states DE is in treatment and would like to set another STC. Court adjourned at 11:37 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
per JRG 10/11/22 - Request for DE to appear via zoom granted. E: DA & Atty. eif
for DE to appear via zoom for 10/11/22 STC filed by Atty Scott Selmer. To JRG for review. eif
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

DEFENDANT TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NOT TO POSSESS CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION
NOT TO OPERATE A MOTOR VEHICLE WITHOUT A VALID DRIVER'S LICENSE.

3:44 PM District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeanette Deltrese Lee Kolpien appeared via Zoom videoconferencing from Pierce County Jail.  Atty. Scott Selmer does not appear.  Hearing set to amend bond so Defendant may attend treatment.  State requests bond converted to $2500 signature bond.  Defendant will be taken to treatment on Monday by Agent, there is still a PO hold.  Defendant has no objection.  Court amends bond.  Hearing will remain on calendar for further scheduling.  Adjourned at 3:47 PM
from Ct Comm Gavic to ADA Schieffer's letter "Pursuant to the hearing on 07/26/22m the request may be address via tele confer today, via tele, at 3:00. JRG"
from ADA Schieffer requesting Defendant's cash bond be reduced to a signature bond so DOC can drop their hold and can attend treatment.

10:17 AM Jeanette Deltrese Lee Kolpien in custody from Jail in person, Atty Scott Selmer, ADA Joseph Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Schieffer spoke with the probation agent and there is a referral for DE but does not have a bed yet. ADA Schieffer has no objection to DE being moved to Eau Claire County Jail upon approval and would like a phone conference. Atty Selmer states DE does agree to remote hearings. ADA Schieffer would like to have another hearing before amending the bond. Court will set a TSC and all approved to appear by phone. If an agreement is reached before it could be set for a BBH at 3:00 pm. Court adjourned at 10:25 am.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:20 AM Defendant Jeanette Deltrese Lee Kolpien appears from Jail in person, Atty Scott Selmer, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Selmer has been trying to reach DE's probation agent and continues to try. Atty Selmer states DE has had contact w/her agent and is trying to get her into inpatient treatment but has not had recent contact and does not have verification. DE is asking to be transported to Eau Claire County Jail. ADA Schieffer is requesting a STC 2 weeks out. Atty Selmer will continue to try to contact DE's agent and would like the hearing sooner. Court adjourned at 11:28 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:15 am.
ALP
filed by Atty Selmer
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Selmer requests bond be addressed and states she is still on a PO Hold but would like bond modified so she could go to treatment. ADA Schieffer requests bond remain. Court denies the motion to modify at this time but will consider a modification if verification of treatment.
Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court adjourned at 1:36 pm.
filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif

1:01 PM Defendant Jeanette Deltrese Lee Kolpien appears in custody from Jail, Atty Scott Selmer, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Inv. Eric Vannocker. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Inv. Vannocker.  Record reflects identification of DE. Court takes judicial notice of Barron Co. case #22CF82. Cross Atty Selmer. ADA Schieffer is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. Atty Selmer argues and states no probable cause. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scott Selmer
Identification Key
records.descr: Order on motion to seal/redact court record

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to possess controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Def from PCJ

3:36 PM Defendant Jeanette Deltrese Lee Kolpien appears in custody from Jail via video, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF107, 22TR923 and 22TR924. DE refused to speak with the PD. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $2,500.00 CB w/conditions of NTO, AS, Not to Possess, objection she is on a PO Hold and cannot get out. Court orders bond as requested. Prelim demanded. Court confirms address and phone number.  Court tries to address 22TR923 and 22TR924, DE refuses to cooperate. Clerk to provide the PD's phone number to DE. Court adjourned at 3:50 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
